intro: Galium huber-morathii, commonly known as the Huber-Morath bedstraw, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. It has opposite, slender leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Galium huber-morathii is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions.
